item.title: 独家报道土耳其出人意料地与欧罗巴航空公司达成协议，关键在于控制权
item.description: 四位消息人士告诉路透社，土耳其航空之所以能出人意料地击败欧洲竞争对手汉莎航空和法航-荷航，收购西班牙航空公司欧洲航空（Air Europa）的股份，在很大程度上是因为土耳其航空愿意与该航空公司的伊达尔戈（Hidalgo）家族所有者分享对该航空公司的控制权。【原文：Turkish Airlines' surprise deal for a stake in Spanish carrier Air Europa, outlasting European rivals Lufthansa and Air France-KLM , was in large part down to its willingness to share control of the carrier with the airline's Hidalgo family owners, four sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 华为人工智能芯片和计算能力路线图中的主要产品
item.description: 中国华为公司（HWT.UL）结束了多年的保密状态，详细介绍了其芯片和计算能力系统的产品路线图，首次讨论了它打算如何挑战全球行业领导者英伟达公司（Nvidia）。【原文：China's Huawei (HWT.UL) has ended years of secrecy to detail its product roadmap for chips and computing power systems, discussing for the first time how it intends to challenge global industry leader Nvidia .】

item.title: 美联储指出将进一步降息后，标普 500 指数和纳斯达克指数期货创下历史新高
item.description: 周四，美国股指期货上涨，在美国央行今年首次降息四分之一点后，与 S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数挂钩的股指期货创下历史新高。【原文：U.S. stock index futures gained on Thursday, with those tied to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq at record highs a day after the U.S. central bank delivered a quarter-point interest rate cut, its first this year.】

item.title: 汽车制造商一直在抵制因关税而提高汽车价格。这种情况可能不会持续太久。
item.description: 自美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税政策于今年 4 月生效以来，汽车制造商一直在吸收数十亿美元的额外开支，从而使美国汽车消费者免受价格冲击。到目前为止【原文：Automakers have been absorbing billions in added expenses since U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariffs took effect in April, sparing American car shoppers from sticker shock. So far.】

item.title: 从 Skechers 到 Foot Locker：关税混乱刺激鞋类和服装交易创新高
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战正助推美国服装和鞋类企业今年的并购创下历史新高，一些企业通过合并来帮助抵消关税成本，而另一些企业则通过私有化在公开市场之外度过其总统任期的未来 3 年半。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's trade war is helping to push U.S. clothing and footwear acquisitions to all-time highs this year, with some companies merging to help offset tariff costs while others go private to weather the next 3-1/2 years of his presidency outside of the public market, dealmakers say.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税后，瑞士对美出口下降超过五分之一
item.description: 官方数据周四显示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对瑞士征收39%关税的8月份，瑞士对美国的商品出口下降了五分之一以上。【原文：Swiss goods exports to the United States dropped by more than a fifth in August, the month in which President Donald Trump imposed 39% tariffs on the country, official data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国校园吸引力下降，印度 upGrad 着眼于亚洲扩张
item.description: 印度教育科技初创公司upGrad的一位高层管理人员表示，由于签证限制和成本障碍，选择去美国和英国留学的学生越来越少，因此该公司正在探索与中东和亚太地区的更多大学建立合作关系。【原文：Indian edtech startup upGrad is exploring more university tie-ups in the Middle East and the Asia-Pacific as fewer students are opting to study in the U.S. and the UK due to visa restrictions and cost hurdles, a top executive said.】

item.title: 行业协会负责人表示，日本应实现石油来源多样化，但加拿大的供应被认为十分困难
item.description: 日本炼油行业协会负责人周四表示，由于日本 95% 的原油进口来自中东，日本炼油企业应考虑实现供应来源多样化，但由于加拿大石油的重质特性，进口加拿大石油可能具有挑战性。【原文：Japanese oil refiners should consider diversifying supply sources as 95% of its crude imports come from the Middle East, but importing Canadian oil could be challenging due to its heavy characteristics, the head of the industry association said on Thursday.】

item.title: 调查发现：过去一年，网络攻击导致德国经济损失 3,000 亿欧元
item.description: 周四公布的一项调查显示，网络攻击越来越多地由外国情报机构而非犯罪分子发起，在过去一年里，德国经济损失近 3,000 亿欧元（3,549.9 亿美元）。【原文：Cyber attacks, launched increasingly often by foreign intelligence agencies rather than criminals, cost the German economy almost 300 billion euros ($354.99 billion) over the past year, according to a survey published on Thursday.】

item.title: 宜家更换首席执行官，专注于资金短缺的消费者
item.description: 全球最大家具品牌宜家家居的所有者周四表示，宜家家居集团首席执行官乔恩-亚伯拉罕松-林（Jon Abrahamsson Ring）将于今年年底卸任，由雅库布-扬科夫斯基（Jakub Jankowski）接任。【原文：Inter IKEA Group CEO Jon Abrahamsson Ring will step down at the end of the year, the owner of the world's biggest furniture brand said on Thursday, with Jakub Jankowski taking over as trade tensions and U.S. tariffs loom over the sector.】

item.title: 雀巢首席执行官希望公司快速发展，并对新想法持开放态度
item.description: 雀巢公司首席执行官菲利普-纳夫拉蒂尔（Philipp Navratil）周四表示，他希望这家瑞士食品公司能够快速发展，并对新想法持开放态度，这是他本月初上任以来首次发表公开评论。【原文：Nestle Chief Executive Philipp Navratil wants the Swiss food company to move fast and be open to fresh ideas, he said on Thursday, in his first public comments since taking charge earlier this month.】

item.title: Deliveroo 首席执行官威尔-舒（Will Shu）将在 DoorDash 被收购后下台
item.description: 英国送餐公司 Deliveroo 周四表示，一旦美国竞争对手 DoorDash 对其的收购生效，创始人兼首席执行官威尔-舒（Will Shu）将辞职。【原文：British food delivery firm Deliveroo said on Thursday founder and CEO Will Shu will step down once its takeover by U.S. rival DoorDash takes effect.】

item.title: 英国章鱼能源公司将分拆技术部门 Kraken
item.description: 随着英国最大的电力供应商专注于核心业务，章鱼能源公司（Octopus Energy）周四表示将分拆其技术部门克拉肯技术公司（Kraken Technologies），并任命蒂姆-温（Tim Wan）为新分拆公司的首席财务官。【原文：Octopus Energy said on Thursday it would spin its technology arm Kraken Technologies off and named Tim Wan as the newly separated company's chief financial officer, as Britain largest electricity supplier focuses on its core operations.】

item.title: 韩国现代重工洽谈收购美国造船厂
item.description: 韩国现代重工公司（HD Hyundai Heavy Industries）的一位高级管理人员表示，该公司正在与多家公司就收购一家美国造船厂进行谈判，以寻求在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的推动下重振美国萎靡不振的造船业。【原文：South Korea's HD Hyundai Heavy Industries is in talks with multiple companies about buying a U.S. shipyard, a senior company executive said, seeking to tap into President Donald Trump's push to revive America's ailing shipbuilding industry.】

item.title: 现代汽车将提高美国产量，因关税打击而降低利润率目标
item.description: 现代汽车（Hyundai Motor）周四表示，为了应对美国的关税政策，该公司计划到2030年在美国生产80%以上的汽车。【原文：Hyundai Motor said on Thursday it aims to produce more than 80% of the vehicles it sells in the U.S. in America by 2030 in response to U.S. tariff policies, as the South Korean automaker ramps up capacity at its Georgia plant.】

item.title: 英美资源集团在澳大利亚布里斯班削减 "少量 "职位
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American）周四称，该公司已在澳大利亚布里斯班办事处和附近的煤矿裁减了 "少量 "工作岗位，作为该公司简化业务、适应煤炭价格下跌和成本上升的努力的一部分。【原文：Anglo American said on Thursday it had cut a "small number" of jobs at its office in Brisbane in Australia and nearby coal mines as part of the miner's efforts to simplify its operations and adapt to lower coal prices and rising costs.】

item.title: 针对英伟达人工智能芯片禁令报道，中国表示愿保持对话
item.description: 针对有报道称中国监管机构下令企业停止采购英伟达人工智能芯片，中国外交部周四表示，中国愿与有关各方保持对话，以保持全球产业链和供应链的稳定。【原文：China is willing to maintain dialogue with all parties involved to keep global industrial and supply chains stable, its foreign ministry said on Thursday in response to reports of the Chinese regulator ordering firms to halt purchases of Nvidia AI chips.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称现代汽车将因安全带问题召回56.85万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，现代汽车公司将在美国召回超过56.85万辆帕利塞德（Palisade）汽车，因为在发生碰撞时，未能锁紧的安全带扣可能无法正确地束缚乘客。【原文：Hyundai Motor is recalling more than 568,500 Palisade vehicles in the U.S., as the seat belt buckles that fail to latch may not properly restrain passengers in a crash, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，丰田将因仪表板问题召回逾 59.1 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国汽车安全监管机构周四表示，由于仪表板显示屏存在问题，无法显示关键信息，增加了车祸或受伤的风险，丰田将在美国召回591377辆汽车。【原文：Toyota is recalling 591,377 vehicles in the U.S. due to an issue with the instrument panel display that does not show critical information, increasing the risk of a crash or injury, the country's auto safety regulator said on Thursday.】

item.title: MBK 控制的乐天卡称近 300 万客户的个人数据被泄露
item.description: 由私募股权基金 MBK 控制的韩国乐天卡公司周四表示，由于受到黑客攻击，约 297 万客户的个人数据已经泄露。【原文：South Korean credit card company Lotte Card, which is controlled by private equity fund MBK, said on Thursday that the personal data of some 2.97 million customers has been leaked due to a hacking attack.】

item.title: 澳大利亚失败的最大收购交易
item.description: 阿布扎比国家石油公司（Abu Dhabi National Oil Company）牵头的一个财团周三撤回了其 187 亿美元收购澳大利亚天然气生产商桑托斯公司（Santos）的报价，在此之前，该财团已就估值和条款争论了数月。【原文：A consortium led by Abu Dhabi National Oil Company on Wednesday withdrew its $18.7 billion offer to buy Australian gas producer Santos after months of wrangling over valuation and terms.】

item.title: 糖果生产商玛氏公司计划投资 12 亿美元促进欧盟业务发展
item.description: 玛氏公司（M&M's）和 Skittles 的制造商玛氏公司周四表示，它将在 2026 年底前向欧盟业务投资 10 亿欧元（11.8 亿美元），以促进该地区的生产、可持续发展和创新。【原文：Mars, the maker of M&M's and Skittles, said on Thursday it will invest 1 billion euros ($1.18 billion) in its European Union operations by the end of 2026 to boost manufacturing, sustainability and innovation pipeline in the region.】

item.title: 巴里卡乐宝首席执行官称债务必须减少
item.description: 本周四发表的一篇采访引用了公司首席执行官彼得-菲尔德（Peter Feld）的话：世界顶级巧克力制造商巴里-卡乐堡（Barry Callebaut）必须减少债务，并正在为此而努力。【原文：The world's top chocolatier Barry Callebaut must reduce its debt and is working to achieve this, CEO Peter Feld was quoted as saying in an interview published on Thursday.】

item.title: 黎巴嫩的不良债务飙升至不稳定的新高度
item.description: 在过去的一年里，黎巴嫩违约政府债券的价格几乎翻了两番，因为投资者押注于经济复苏的迹象。【原文：Lebanon's defaulted government bonds have nearly quadrupled in price over the past year as investors bet on signs of economic recovery but a wild variance in estimates of their likely worth after a restructuring could restrain any further rally.】

item.title: 消息人士称，软银与 OpenAI 日本人工智能合资公司推迟成立
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，软银与 OpenAI 成立合资公司，为日本企业客户提供人工智能服务的计划大大落后于原定计划。【原文：SoftBank's plans to set up a joint venture with OpenAI to bring artificial intelligence services to corporate customers in Japan are significantly behind schedule, according to a source familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 如果嘉能可同意，盎格鲁-泰克合并将释放智利矿山的协同效应
item.description: 英美资源集团与泰克集团合并的提议重燃了智利北部两大矿山共享基础设施的长期雄心，但分析师称，该计划可能面临获得瑞士矿商和贸易商嘉能可公司（Glencore）收购的障碍。【原文：The proposed Anglo American-Teck merger has revived long-standing ambitions to share infrastructure at two major mines in northern Chile, but analysts say the plan could face hurdles to gain buy-in from Swiss miner and trader Glencore.】

item.title: 外国人在中断两个月后于 8 月份抢购亚洲债券
item.description: 8 月份，亚洲债券吸引了三个月来的首次月度外资流入，原因是美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）降息以支持劳动力市场降温的预期刺激了对高收益新兴市场的需求。【原文：Asian bonds attracted their first monthly foreign inflow in three months in August, as expectations of U.S. Federal Reserve rate cuts to support a cooling labour market boosted demand for higher-yielding emerging markets.】

item.title: 研究发现，美国对欧盟的进口依存度正在上升，超过了中国
item.description: 根据德国 IW 经济研究所的一项研究，美国对从欧盟进口的依赖程度比人们通常认为的要高，无论是总价值还是商品数量，欧盟都超过了中国。【原文：The United States relies more heavily on imports from the European Union than commonly assumed, with the bloc surpassing China in both total value and the number of goods, according to a study from Germany's IW economic institute.】

item.title: 罗氏拟最高 35 亿美元收购肝脏药物开发商 89bio
item.description: 罗氏公司周四表示，同意以不超过 35 亿美元的价格收购美国生物技术公司 89bio ETNB.O，以加强其在肝脏和心脏代谢疾病治疗方面的开发管线。【原文：Roche said on Thursday it agreed to acquire U.S. biotech firm 89bio ETNB.O for up to $3.5 billion to strengthen its development pipeline on liver and cardiometabolic disease treatments.】

item.title: 斯塔默和特朗普将在充满奢华的王室欢迎仪式后讨论外交事务和投资问题
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四将与英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）举行会谈，旨在将美国领导人史无前例的第二次国事访问的重点坚定地放在全球事务上，而不是国内政治问题上。【原文：Donald Trump meets British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday for talks designed to focus the U.S. leader's unprecedented second state visit firmly on global affairs rather than domestic political problems.】
